required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Camrelizumab Plus Chemotherapy vs Placebo Plus Chemotherapy as Neoadjuvant Therapy in Participants With Triple Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-controlled Phase Ⅲ Study to Evaluate Camrelizumab Plus Chemotherapy vs Placebo Plus Chemotherapy as Neoadjuvant Therapy in Patients With Early or Locally Advanced Triple Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC).

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of camrelizumab (an engineered anti-programmed death-ligand 1 [PD-1] antibody) plus chemotherapy vs placebo plus chemotherapy as neoadjuvant therapy in participants with triple negative breast cancer (TNBC). Participants will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio to Arm A (camrelizumab +chemotherapy) or Arm B (placebo + chemotherapy).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Pathological complete response (pCR) rate using the definition of ypT0/Tis ypN0 (i.e., no invasive residual in breast or nodes; noninvasive breast residuals allowed) at the time of definitive surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Event-free Survival (EFS) as assessed by Investigator.
secondary_outcome.description: EFS is defined as the time from randomization to any of the following events: progression of disease that precludes surgery, local or distant recurrence, second primary malignancy (breast or other cancers) or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease-free Survival (DFS) as assessed by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: DFS is defined as the time from surgery to any of the following events: local or distant recurrence, or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Distant Disease-free Survival (DDFS) as assessed by Investigator
secondary_outcome.description: DDFS is defined as the time from surgery to distant recurrence, or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate (ORR) in accordance with RECIST v1.1
secondary_outcome.description: Number of responders Assessed by Modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumours (RECIST v1.1) for target lesions assessed by MRI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ECOG Performance Status of 0-1.
- Early or locally advanced, histologically documented TNBC (absence of HER2, ER, and PR expression).
- Tumor stage: II-III.
- Adequate hematologic and organ function.
- Must be willing to use an adequate method of contraception for the course of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a history of breast cancer.
- Has a history of invasive malignancy ≤5 years prior to signing informed consent except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer or in situ cervical cancer.
- Has received prior chemotherapy, targeted therapy, and radiation therapy within the past 12 months.
- Has received prior therapy with an anti-programmed cell death protein 1 (anti-PD-1), anti-programmed death - ligand 1 (anti-PD-L1), or anti-PD-L2 agent or with an agent directed to another co-inhibitory T-cell receptor (e.g., cytotoxic T-lymphocyte-associated antigen-4 [CTLA-4].
- Has a diagnosis of immunodeficiency or autoimmune diseases.
- Has received any form of immunosuppressive therapy within 4 weeks prior to the first dose of study treatment.
- Severe pulmonary or cardiac disease.
- Known active hepatitis C virus, or known active hepatitis B virus.
- History of organ or bone marrow transplantation.
- Pregnant or breast-feeding women.
